meanings.definition: With an attitude or look of suspicion or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She gave him an askant glance when he arrived late.
meanings.sent2: The teacher looked askant at the student who was whispering during the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat askant, eyeing the new puppy cautiously.
meanings.sent4: His askant expression made it clear he was not pleased with the decision.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds gathered askant, foretelling a storm.

meanings.sent3: The tower leaned askant after the earthquake, looking ready to topple.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches stretched askant towards the sky, reaching for the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The road twisted askant up the mountain, making the journey more challenging.
